intro: Iryanthera hostmannii, commonly known as the hostmann's iryanthera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and requires well-drained soil. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
